name: Bilateral Symmetry Detection
description: Detects unusually high bilateral symmetry in images. AI-generated images often exhibit unnatural mirror symmetry that real scenes rarely have.
mechanism: Computes pixel-level correlation between left/right and top/bottom image halves. Unusually high symmetry scores suggest AI generation.
parameters: Comparison: left-right flip correlation, Metric: normalized cross-correlation, Threshold: adaptive
source: Loy & Eklundh (2006) — Detecting Symmetry and Symmetric Constellations of Features, ECCV
useCase: Identifying perfection artifacts from symmetry-biased AI generation

references.title: Loy, G. & Eklundh, J.O. (2006). Detecting Symmetry and Symmetric Constellations of Features. ECCV.

strengths:
• Simple and fast computation
• Captures a unique AI artifact type
• Does not require training data
• Complementary to structural methods
limitations:
• Many real images have natural symmetry
• Low standalone accuracy
• Easily defeated by asymmetric AI prompts
• Only detects one specific artifact type
